intro: Callicarpa stapfii, commonly known as the Chinese beautyberry, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its clusters of vibrant purple berries that appear in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in umbels, and it thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. The berries are not only ornamental but also attract birds and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
